messages: 54e157e13dc41559603708f542744774 (02:10): Hi there guys, this has probably been asked a million times but here goes...
54e157e13dc41559603708f542744774 (02:10): my current version of apache's root directory seems to be /var/www/
54e157e13dc41559603708f542744774 (02:11): however this directory is only accessibly by root it would seem
54e157e13dc41559603708f542744774 (02:11): how can I create say a new server for each user..
561ac59e11a6a8e4d65256d063f7d174 (02:12): That'll give you something like www.myserver.com/~username - which is ~username/public_html by default
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:14): fartmastr: iirc, there's a port selection screen in the installation.
57f6257af257254a6d5bf004cdc3ebe5 (02:14): yes, and 80 is the default, and i clicked that
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:15): Dyegova: that url you gave me in msg while i was idling? it gave a 404
57f6257af257254a6d5bf004cdc3ebe5 (02:15): if i clicked 8080 i wouldnt have the service
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:15): waht is the ending $ for
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:16): fartmastr: i'm going to be installing the 2.2.2 msi again in a bit; i'll verify the behavior
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:16): [14:12] <_Lewellyn> Dyegova: that url you gave me in msg while i was idling? it gave a 404
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:16): well. it's got a web server :)
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:17): I gave it to other people and they said it worked

a0845da1ef8d467511f73950eb5e6df9 (02:17): curious question... what would be the best way of directing http://example.com/webmail to a second machine on an internal network instead of to the built in webmail on the original machine?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:18): got a smileycentral popup which spawned 2 others
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:18): ohh it should be mi@
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:20): bah. it worked for me
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:20): Apache/2.2.2 (Win32) DAV/2 mod_ssl/2.2.2 OpenSSL/0.9.8b mod_autoindex_color PHP/5.1.4
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:20): it worked for everyone else
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:20): where can I get a subdomain without pop-ups?
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:21): I've tried that, but it says my domain is broken
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:21): jpeg: Apache/2.0.54 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.0.54 OpenSSL/0.9.7e PHP/4.4.0 mod_perl/2.0.1 Perl/v5.8.6
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:21): things that make you go
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:22): are you trying to host a domain with them? or get a subdomain?
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:22): I don't really know XD
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:22): well... do you OWN a domain?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:23): then log into freedns.afraid.org and click subdomains or web forward
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:23): go out on a limb, spend 7 or 8 dollars a year and get you one
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:23): and click in "Add a Web Forward"?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:23): errr: that gets more offtopic than i want to :)
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:23): Dyegov: if you want a web forward rather than a real subdomian
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:24): I don't know the difference beteewn them
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:24): a webforward will take http://subdomain.afraid.org/ and point it to any other url such as http://125.34.24.1:81/path/to/stuff/
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:25): a subdomain becomes a ServerName or ServerAlias in your config file
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:25): I still don't understand subdomain
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:26): noodl may be better at describing a subdomain vs a web forward than i am able to right now
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:26): noodl: to keep it simple, that's all the context you need :)
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:26): he needs to decide on a subdomain vs a web forward
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:27): a webforward will take http://subdomain.afraid.org/ and point it to any other url such as http://125.34.24.1:81/path/to/stuff/
a83eaf7e57de689ffb2d0892b8ed1b2a (02:27): I don't understand the subdomain
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:27): ya, web forward is the marketing term
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:28): Have you registered a domain name, Dyegov?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:28): web forward also prevents overloading the term slightly l(
